[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Struct: AptosBaseUrl] [Enum exhaustiveness] Can adding new AptosBaseUrl variants without updating to_url() cause pattern matching errors or use uninitialized URLs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Dependency: reqwest] [HTTP/2 vulnerabilities] Does the reqwest client enable HTTP/2 which could be vulnerable to rapid reset or CONTINUATION frame attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Dependency: reqwest] [Redirect following] Does the client automatically follow HTTP redirects, potentially allowing malicious servers to redirect to internal endpoints? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Dependency: url::Url] [URL parsing inconsistencies] Can differences between Rust url crate parsing and server-side URL parsing cause request smuggling or path traversal? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::new()] [SDK version spoofing] Can an attacker modify X_APTOS_SDK_HEADER_VALUE to impersonate different SDK versions, potentially bypassing version-specific security mitigations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::build()] [Proxy bypass] Does the client builder configuration allow proxy settings that could route traffic through attacker-controlled proxies? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: AptosBaseUrl::Custom] [Localhost bypass] Can Custom URLs pointing to localhost or 127.0.0.1 be used to exploit local services or bypass network restrictions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::header()] [Host header injection] Can the header() function be used to set a custom Host header that causes virtual host confusion or request routing to wrong backends? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::api_key()] [Timing attack] Does api_key() processing time vary based on key length or content, potentially allowing timing attacks to extract valid API key formats? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::build()] [DNS rebinding protection] Does the built client validate that DNS resolution results remain consistent across connection lifetime to prevent DNS rebinding attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::timeout()] [Timeout inheritance] Are timeout values properly inherited by all sub-requests, or can long-running operations bypass timeout restrictions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::new()] [Header size limit] Is there a limit on the number or total size of headers that can be added, or can unbounded header accumulation cause memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::build()] [Certificate pinning bypass] Does the client perform certificate pinning for known Aptos domains, or can attackers use valid certificates from other CAs for MITM attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: AptosBaseUrl::to_url()] [Subdomain takeover] Are the hardcoded Aptos URLs vulnerable to subdomain takeover if DNS records are misconfigured, allowing attackers to impersonate official nodes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::api_key()] [Key rotation safety] If API keys are rotated, does the old key remain in memory or can it be extracted through memory dumps or swap files? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::build()] [Connection reuse] Can connection reuse across different security contexts cause credential leakage between different API key contexts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Integration: All methods] [Builder pattern state] Can calling builder methods in unexpected order (e.g., build() before setting base_url()) create insecure default configurations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::header()] [Accept header manipulation] Can setting Accept headers to unexpected MIME types cause the server to return sensitive data in different formats bypassing output encoding? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::timeout()] [Partial response attack] Can a malicious server exploit timeout handling to deliver partial responses that are accepted as valid by the client? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: AptosBaseUrl::Custom] [IPv6 confusion] Can Custom URLs with IPv6 addresses be used to bypass IPv4-based firewall rules or access controls? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::build()] [HTTP version downgrade] Can the client be forced to downgrade from HTTP/2 to HTTP/1.1, potentially enabling request smuggling attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::new()] [Environment variable race] Can the X_API_KEY environment variable be modified by another process between the check and use, causing TOCTOU vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::header()] [Invalid UTF-8] How does HeaderValue::from_str() handle invalid UTF-8 sequences, and can this be exploited to cause parsing errors or bypass validation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: ClientBuilder::api_key()] [Format string vulnerability] Does the format! macro properly escape the api_key parameter, or can format string exploits inject arbitrary header content? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/client_builder.rs] [Function: AptosBaseUrl::to_url()] [Static string corruption] Can memory corruption or buffer overflows cause the static URL strings to be modified, leading to connections to attacker-controlled servers? (Low)
